Author: Pistachio Herald
Name: Autogardener
Punchline: Tend to your plot in one click
Description: Tend to your plot in one click. Type /autog to start.
Changelog:
- Garden patches now have information about their residential area, and the patches from different areas won't be highlighted. Patches in different instance of the same area (for instance lavender beds ward 12 and ward 16) will still show, nothing I can do about that without a ton of work. Not worth it.
- Flowerpots are now counted as separate entities each, instead of being sometimes merged into one.
- Newly registered plots or flowerpots will have the area name (for instance, Mist L 1 would be in a Large house in Mist)
- Moved plots' location is updated when you see them again
- Removed plots will print a warning so the user know they should delete them
- Throttled and optimized the garden patch background lookup. It still only runs when the main window is open.
- Flowerpots refuse to work properly. Just don't use this for flowerpots. Just don't.
TestingChangelog:
- Plugin can now identify and update moved plots
- Added a button to mark the location of a plot on the map
- "Plot missing" message no longer shows in non-residential areas
- Flowerpots are now impossible to register. That is a good thing.

Author: Pistachio Herald
Name: Faded Orchestrion Roll Fixer
Punchline: Generate a crafting list for the faded orchestrion rolls in your inventory
Description: Generate a crafting list for the faded orchestrion rolls in your inventory. Use /faded to begin

Author: Pistachio Herald
Name: Flash On Ready Check
Punchline: I'm ready, I was just alt tabbed!
Description: Flash FFXIV's program on the taskbar when a /readycheck starts. Use /readyflash to test the window flashing.

Author: Pistachio Herald, based on Anna's Orange Guidance Tomestone
Name: North Star
Punchline: Let the heaven's guide you, not the map
Description: Shows a beacon on the position of the last <pos> or <flag> in chat. Use /northstar to configure
